title: Ping(ms) issues heard round the world
body:
Hi guys, so as of the last 2 days, i have had increasingly severe spikes from 30ms to 1000 since one of the most recent updates.... Ive had a look around and found heaps of stuff on it with little hotfixes for windows 10, p2p and ipv6 settings, and a whole bunch of other stuff that ive tinkered with, but NOWHERE have i seen a solid reply from Riot letting the community know what the go is...

so my question is twofold, (A) Will riot acknowledge its a severe issue across the entire game?? (posts from EU and NA as well as OCE were found) and (B) when in the world can we expect some kind of peace of mind, not having to queue ranked in fear of absolute annihilation??

replies.body:
Hey there,

Could you do the following for me.

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text and reply back with them here (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this)
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/) and post back with a link to your results here.

|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

|                                      WinMTR statistics                                   |

^^^^^^

Thats what i have, after 5 minutes its adverage was sitting around 1400 then i played a bots game, sitting at around 500 all game with spikes to 1600...

Hey there,

There's definitely some noticeable packet loss on your connection, originating locally and on your ISP's end, you'll have to contact them regarding these issues. (Switching to a wired connection if you're not already on one may help with the local packet loss)

From your netalyzr results there's a few things you can fix on your end that may help.

* Your current DNS servers are functioning unexpectedly, please [switch to a public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5).
*  There is a rather high packet buffering rate on your connection, this can be caused by certain applications running.
  *  Please see [this article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq7) for a list of applications that are known to increase the buffering rate.

So ive switched to a public DNS, and my overall statistics on speedtest.net had dropped noticeably, re-ran WinMTR and received roughly the same results as above, so nothing has changed...

I also want to add that i dont believe my internet is the issue as nothing else is affected but league of legends since the 6.6 patch, ive also used skype to talk in the past and had videos downloading with my ping sitting consistantly on 30, only ever hitting 80-90 ingame occasionally, the same with my 2 roommates streaming, i have a healthy ping on all my games currently even on the PS3 online im getting green bar....  so it cannot possibly be packet buffering on my end :*(


EDIT---- I have seen that there are a few disrupted internet services with optus in my area (SE Melbourne), when it changes ill check again and post updates here!

And here is the netalyzr completed session link, also my ISP is Optus and i run their Cable internet connection.... 

http://n1.netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/restore/id=43ca253f-32393-a9a7d46a-0539-45f3-9994/rd
Hey mate running the traceroute now, is this just for a log for riot? What will be the outcome of this information?? :)
im guessing this will be resolved as of patch 6.7??
